meanings.definition: To diminish the worth or value of something.
meanings.sent1: Constant complaints can be detracting from the team's morale.
meanings.sent2: His rude behavior is detracting from the overall dining experience.
meanings.sent3: The noisy seagulls detracting from the peaceful beach vibes.
meanings.sent4: Her absence at the party was like detracting a star from the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti on the historic building was detracting and disrespectful.

meanings.definition: To take away from the quality or reputation of something.
meanings.sent1: Adding too many ads can be detracting from the website's user experience.
meanings.sent2: The scandal is detracting from the politician's credibility.
meanings.sent3: The loud music detracting from the seriousness of the meeting.
meanings.sent4: His constant lateness is like detracting from his reliability.
meanings.sent5: The outdated decor was detracting from the charm of the cafe.
